meanings.definition: The sale of property or goods by a party who is not the original owner.
meanings.sent1: The subsale of the car was completed by the second-hand dealer.
meanings.sent2: I heard about a subsale of used furniture happening next weekend.
meanings.sent3: At the subsale, the new owner accidentally bought back their own item!
meanings.sent4: The subsale of the antique mirror felt like a passing of history to a new generation.
meanings.sent5: The subsale sign outside the house caught the attention of many passersby.

meanings.definition: To sell property or goods that were previously purchased from another party.
meanings.sent1: She decided to subsale the old books she no longer needed.
meanings.sent2: After fixing up the bike, he was able to subsale it for a good price.
meanings.sent3: The kids subsaled their toys to earn some extra pocket money.
meanings.sent4: He managed to subsale the rare coin collection to a collector.
meanings.sent5: The company had to subsale excess inventory to make room for new stock.
